# discord_message (Resource)

Creates and manages a Discord message in a channel.

## Example Usage

```terraform
terraform {
  required_providers {
    discord = {
      source  = "tfstack/discord"
      version = "~> 0.1"
    }
  }
}

provider "discord" {}

# Create a channel first
resource "discord_channel" "general" {
  name     = "general"
  type     = "text"
  guild_id = "1452601985235816601" # Replace with your guild ID
}

# Send a simple message
resource "discord_message" "hello" {
  channel_id = discord_channel.general.id
  content    = "Hello from Terraform! ðŸ‘‹"
}

# Send a message with text-to-speech
resource "discord_message" "tts_example" {
  channel_id = discord_channel.general.id
  content    = "This message will be read aloud!"
  tts        = true
}

output "hello_message_id" {
  value = discord_message.hello.message_id
}

output "tts_message_id" {
  value = discord_message.tts_example.message_id
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `channel_id` (String) The ID of the channel to send the message to.

### Optional

- `content` (String) The content of the message. Must be 1-2000 characters. At least one of content or embed must be provided.
- `tts` (Boolean) Whether the message should be sent as text-to-speech. Defaults to false.

### Read-Only

- `author` (String) The ID of the user who sent the message.
- `edited_at` (String) When the message was last edited (ISO 8601 timestamp). Null if never edited.
- `id` (String) The ID of the message (same as message_id).
- `message_id` (String) The ID of the message.
- `timestamp` (String) When the message was sent (ISO 8601 timestamp).
